arts.ttl: Critchley feels like he's 'been through tumble dryer' after Hearts defeat
arts.sum: Hearts head coach Neil Critchley says he felt like he had "been through a tumble dryer" after his side were beaten by 10-man Kilmarnock.

arts.ttl: Ten-man Kilmarnock keep Hearts bottom of table
Danny Armstrong challenge would have seen 'jail time' in Croatia as Dundee United's Vicko Sevelj blasts Killie star
arts.sum: Defender Sevelj was on the wrong end of a heavy tackle against last weekend and was left stunned that referee Steven McLean didn't even award a free-kick

arts.ttl: What Cammy Devlin and Lawrence Shankland Hearts argument was about as Aussie lifts the lid on Copenhagen 'misunderstanding'
arts.sum: Midfielder was seen in a heated discussion with his skipper at the Parken Stadium on Thursday night but he insists it's just proof of the passion flowing through the side.

arts.ttl: Neil Critchley's Hearts penalty gripe branded 'ridiculous' as Copenhagen boss tells him why it didn't matter anyway
arts.sum: Critchley was furious with the 78th minute spot kick award which he claimed cost his side the chance to go after a late leveller.

arts.ttl: Craig Gordon 'let down' by Hearts refereeing drama as VAR blunder incenses Jambos veteran
arts.sum: However, with little over 10 minutes left, a lofted ball saw Gordon and Chiakha enter a footrace for the ball, with the Scot seemingly getting the first touch before Chiakha went down. Initially, the referee didn't see anything doing; but after being summoned to the VAR screen, he gave a penalty - and told Gordon that if he complained, he would be booked for complaining.

arts.ttl: Craig Gordon reveals Hearts penalty protest was threatened with further punishment from ropey Copenhagen ref
arts.sum: Gordon was told to pipe down by Italian whistler Andrew Colombo after Conference League penalty award
